name: clerically
content:
clerically adverb
(OFFICE WORK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to work done in an office, or the people that work there : They say the problem is caused by a computer fault, and they're having to deal with all queries clerically. I received a long, polite, clerically neat, handwritten letter.

clerically adverb
(PRIEST)
in a way that relates to a priest or priests : The country transformed itself from a post-colonial, clerically dominated backwater to a prosperous independent state. During the Middle Ages, these punishments were clerically imposed by the Catholic church.
